description: A master pro-inflammatory cytokine that modulates multiple signalling pathways and plays a vital role in the immune response.
One of the two receptors for tumour necrosis factor, categorised into the TNFR superfamily.
The second receptor for tumour necrosis factor, also part of the TNFR superfamily.
An autoimmune disease that causes chronic inflammation of the joints.
A type of arthritis that causes inflammation of the spine and the joints.
A type of inflammatory bowel disease that causes inflammation of the digestive tract.
